definition:
Let ${\mathfrak{g}}$ be a Lie algebra. Then the nilradical $\mathfrak n$
of ${\mathfrak{g}}$ is defined to be the intersection of the kernels of
all the irreducible representations of ${\mathfrak{g}}$. Equivalently,
${\mathfrak{n}}=[{\mathfrak{g}},{\mathfrak{g}}]\cap\mathrm{rad}\,{\mathfrak{g}}$,
the intersection of the derived ideal and radical of ${\mathfrak{g}}$.
